thread.title: Peeps Oreos are here and they're not as gross as the Easter treat
thread.title_full: Peeps Oreos are here and they're not as gross as the Easter treat - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Peeps Oreos are here and they're not as gross as the Easter treat
text:
Try it... * It’s a sneak peep at spring. Oreo teamed up with Peeps — the brightly colored Easter candy favorite — for a limited edition, marshmallow Peeps flavored creme cookie. The vibrant pink frosting that stains your tongue is sandwiched between vanilla cookies. The combo tastes a bit like Lucky Charms cereal with hints of cinnamon. The Peeps Oreos are super sweet, but taste a lot better than a Peep on its own. A bag retails for $4.49.
* Nespresso has launched Selection Vintage 2014 , its first-ever aged brew, harvested three years ago and made from fresh arabica coffee sourced from Colombia. The result is a complex, bold flavor with fruity and earthy notes. Available for OriginalLine and Vertuo machines at all Nespresso Boutiques.
Nespresso has launched its first aged coffee, Selection Vintage 2014. (Nespresso) Get it while you can... * Rome import Antica Pesa , in Williamsburg (115 Berry St.), has launched a new seasonal menu with a few seafood highlights to keep you warm until spring. For starters, there’s grilled octopus served atop creamy mashed potatoes. Entrees include grilled branzino layered with fried eggplant in a broccoli sauce; and red snapper crusted in bread and herbs served with zucchini in a pumpkin cream. This posh, Italian gem has hosted celebs like Leonardo DiCaprio, Amy Adams and Madonna. Cozy up by the fireplace with a glass of Chianti and enjoy.
The branzino at Antica Pesa. (Courtesy of Antica Pesa) The red snapper at Antica Pesa. (Courtesy of Antica Pesa) Happening this week... * Celebrate Fat Tuesday with a big, fat meal. Chef Francis Derby of The Cannibal (113 E. 29th St.) in Midtown is rounding up chef friends like Cook Shop’s Adrienne Gagnier and Talde’s Dale Talde for an all-you-can-eat and drink party Tuesday, Feb. 28 from 3 - 10 p.m. Each chef will showcase their signature spin on a pork dish using a 250-pound Mangalitsa pig. Wash down the grub with New Orleans-inspired cocktails like milk punches, sazeracs and zombies. Tickets are $125 at eventbrite.com.
'Waitress' cookbook, legit meat pies at 'Sweeney Todd' 
Coming soon... * The Green Room , an immersive, 120-seat live music club and restaurant , is opening March 5 in the heart of the Theater District, the Daily News has exclusively learned. It’ll be housed inside YOTEL (570 Tenth Ave.) on the fourth floor. Green Fig chef Gabriel Israel has created a Mediterranean-inspired menu of sharable plates and riffs on American classics like king oyster mushrooms; falafel bites; and tuna tartare with charred eggplant puree. Larger plates include a baked beef kebab; steak frites and a BBQ schnitzel sandwich. Expect live music from singers like “American Idol” finalist Constantine Maroulis (March 12) and Tony winner Alice Ripley (April 1) .
